summary: brendan rodgers has reminded raheem sterling and jordon ibe about their professional responsibilities . brendan rodgers ( left ) has n't disciplined sterling ( pictured ) or ibe for the incident . rodgers , who has steven gerrard available for the fa cup semi-final with aston villa , spoke to sterling and ibe in his office on thursday but neither will be disciplined .

2. Sterling and Ibe were exposed for inhaling legal high nitrous oxide and smoking shisha pipes.

explain: Brendan Rodgers spoke to Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities after they were involved in a photoshoot with betta fish and cigarettes.
A core idea of this aspect is that the players were exposed for using legal high nitrous oxide and smoking shisha pipes.

The core idea of the given aspect is that Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers has decided not to discipline or punish the players Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe for their recent behaviour at a nightclub despite warning them about their responsibilities as professionals.

The core idea of the given aspect is that Liverpool manager Brendan Rodgers wants to move on from the recent incident involving Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe, in which they were photographed smoking shisha pipes, and focus on the upcoming FA Cup semi-final against Aston Villa. Rodgers has addressed the matter with the two players and has decided not to discipline them, instead choosing to put the matter behind them and concentrate on the important game against Villa. The aspect suggests that the incident is not considered serious enough to disrupt the team's preparation for the cup tie.

The core idea of Rodgers wanting to steer Liverpool into their first FA Cup final of his reign is that the Liverpool manager is motivated to win the football cup tournament and has focused his efforts towards achieving this goal.
